result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Dated 09/26/2022, Letter from Attorney Van Daalwyk to Clerk regarding filing of Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: SPD Appointment - Attorney Jansen Van Daalwyk

(Cases 22CM521, 22CM755 ae called at 11:13 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Curtis Daniels Jr. appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney  Rachel Robole. ADA Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant in 22CM521 is executed and previously ordered bond remains in effect. Defendant waives reading of the complaint in 22CM755. Defendant updates phone number and is eligible for Public Defender representation. State requests $1,500 cash bond to cover 22CM755. Defense requests lower cash bond. Court orders $1,000 cash bond in 22CM755 with various conditions. 
Discussion held regarding status of other pending cases. Defense requests bond modification in all open cases. 
Court orders bond conditions in 22CM521 are modified and any modification in any other cases will need to have a motion filed to be heard by the responsible branch. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/19/2022 at 2:45 PM. 
Hearing: 10/03/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward O.F.
